page.title: 05Landscape
page.content: One of the leveliest views is over the wall near Green Castle. You look up the River Towy and see the twists and curves up to Carmarthen Town. You see the newer area of development on the hills which act as a backdrop to the town. The higher land in the foreground is crowned by a large farm, with its out-houses white-washed and looking clean. Across the river we can see the main London to Fishguard railway line. Another point of vantage is the top of Alltyenap Hill Here if you look to the west you can see the village of Llanllwch with its church immediately below you and the land stretching out in front like a map with the new extension of M4 going off in the distance. If you look north you again get a view of Carmarthen with its hills behind it.
